Caustic
namespace
Caustic
IImageBase

Base interface shared across all image types

Functions
GetData
virtual uint8 *GetData() = 0

Returns a pointer to the image data

GetWidth
virtual uint32 GetWidth() = 0

Returns the image's width in pixels

GetHeight
virtual uint32 GetHeight() = 0

Returns the image's height in pixels

GetStride
virtual uint32 GetStride() = 0

Returns the image's stride (bytes/scanline)

GetBytesPerPixel
virtual uint32 GetBytesPerPixel() = 0

Returns the number of bytes in each pixel

IImage

Interface to an image (CPU based)

Functions
GaussianBlur
virtual void GaussianBlur(
float sigma,
IImage **ppImage
) = 0

Perfoms a gaussian blur on the image

Parameters
sigma
float

sigma for determining width of gaussian filter

ppImage
IImage**

Returns the blurred image

ShowAlpha
virtual void ShowAlpha(
int boxSize,
IImage **ppResult
) = 0

Outputs an image that has the alpha applied to the image data.  The output image is a checkerboard blended with the image data.

Parameters
boxSize
int

size of checkerboard square

ppResult
IImage**

Image with alpha applied

Clone
virtual void Clone(
IImage **ppImage
) = 0

Makes a copy of the image

Parameters
ppImage
IImage**

Copy of the image

DrawCircle
virtual void DrawCircle(
Vector2 &center,
uint32 radius,
uint8 color[4]
) = 0

Renders a circle on the image

Parameters
center
Vector2&

center of the circle in pixel coordinates

radius
uint32

radius of the circle (in pixels)

color
uint8[4]

color used for rendering the circle

DrawLine
virtual void DrawLine(
Vector2 &v0,
Vector2 &v1,
uint8 color[4]
) = 0

Renders a line on the image

Parameters
v0
Vector2&

start of line (in pixel coordinates)

v1
Vector2&

end of line (in pixel coordinates)

color
uint8[4]

color used for rendering the line

Clear
virtual void Clear() = 0

Erases the image (setting it to black with full alpha)

SetPixel
virtual void SetPixel(
uint32 x,
uint32 y,
uint8 color[4]
) = 0

Sets a pixel in the image

Parameters
x
uint32

pixel's X coordinate

y
uint32

pixel's Y coordinate

color
uint8[4]

color to set pixel to

IIntegralImage

Interface to an integral image (see https://​en​.wikipedia​.org​/wiki​/Summed-area_table)

Functions
GetSum
virtual uint32 GetSum(
int channel,
int x1,
int y1,
int x2,
int y2
) = 0

Returns the sum of the requested area

Parameters
channel
int

which color channel to sum

x1
int

top left corner's X coordinate (in pixel coordinates)

y1
int

top left corner's Y coordinate (in pixel coordinates)

x2
int

bottom right corner's X coordinate (in pixel coordinates)

y2
int

bottom right corner's Y coordinate (in pixel coordinates)
